etymology.description: 酋(酋) (qiú, "wine") + 寸(寸) (cùn, "hand") = to give a hand offering a vessel of wine -> show respect
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the idea of offering wine with a hand, symbolizing an act of respect or veneration. This representation aligns with the traditional use of vessels in rituals and offerings to deities or important figures.

examples.chinese: 这座青铜尊(這座青銅尊)，见证了历史(見證了歷史)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò qīngtóng zūn, jiànzhèngle lìshǐ.

examples.chinese: 博物馆收藏的珍贵尊(博物館收藏的珍貴尊)，代表着古代工艺(代表著古代工藝)。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguǎn shōucáng de zhēnguì zūn, dàibiǎozhe gǔdài gōngyì.
examples.english: The precious vessel collected by the museum represents ancient craftsmanship.

examples.chinese: 考古学家在遗址中发现了一尊完好的瓷尊(考古學家在遺址中發現了一尊完好的瓷尊)，令世人称奇(令世人稱奇)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎogǔ xuéjiā zài yízhǐ zhōng fāxiànle yì sù wánhǎo de cí zūn, lìng shìrén chēngqí.
examples.english: Archaeologists discovered a well-preserved porcelain vessel at the site, which amazed the world.
